title: Internal issue: Coverage build is broken
body:
## Issue

The reason we haven't been getting coverage reports in some time is because, well, the coverage build is broken, and has been for quite a while.  The errors don't seem to be inconsistent; they happen every time and appear to reflect some sort of real problem. 

## Actual Results

For instance, the most recent `develop` coverage build failed as follows:

```
Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have
requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:
The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 solc : Depends: libc6 (>= 2.29) but 2.23-0ubuntu11 is to be installed
        Depends: libgcc-s1 (>= 3.0) but it is not installable
        Depends: libstdc++6 (>= 9) but 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.11 is to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
error Command failed with exit code 100.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
The command "yarn ci" exited with 100.
```

And, well, this is the same error I always seem to see when I look at why coverage builds failed.  So, there seems to be a real problem here.
